intro: Klasea chanetii, commonly known as the Chanetii's klasea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow to orange in color, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Klasea chanetii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
